programmes.show_description: 1960. The Last Train. Directed by Geoffrey Muller. Starring Russell Napier, Norman Johns and Lisa Daniely. Duggan investigates a murder in the London Underground. (S1, E33)
Hidden Scars - Part 1. 1974. Stars Maureen Lipman, Godfrey Quigley & William Mervyn. The bursar of a charitable school is accused of misusing funds though investments and using the money himself.
Hidden Scars - Part 2. 1974. Stars Terrance Hardiman, Stephen Murray & Ann Castle. Cresswell's wife let slip that she advised the defendant to invest in Metalia on behalf of his disabled daughter.
Hidden Scars - Part 3. 1974. Stars Liz Smith, Stefan Gryff & Morris Perry. Fowkes says charitable money could be given to his daughter. His wife said the money was from a generous friend.
1950. Drama. Directed by Nicholas Ray. Stars Humphrey Bogart & Gloria Grahame. When a screenwriter is accused of murder his neighbour comes to his rescue, but she soon starts to have her doubts.
Founder of Talking Pictures TV and one half of the Footage Detectives, Noel Cronin, shares shows and films not to be missed at the end of February and beginning of March.
1963. Who Killed Billy Jo? Directed by Hy Averback. Stars Gene Barry, Gary Conway & Regis Toomey. A recording star is murdered. Was the killer his agent, sister, music arranger, or someone else?
1960. A Question Of Courage. Stars Michael Ansara, Claude Atkins & Patricia Donahue. Sam investigates a series of shootings after reading an anonymous letter about the incompetence of the sheriff.
Take a trip to the 60s as Colette Magny performs the song Basin St Blues.
1949. Drama. Director: Louis King. Stars Dick Powell, Evelyn Keyes & J.M Kerrigan. Kathy O'Fallon meets Mountie Mike Flannigan. They fall in love, but can their love survive?
1956. Drama. Directed by Brian Desmond Hurst. Stars Donald Sinden, Anna-Maria Sandri & Anthony Steel. After the war, a young man sets out in search of his missing older brother.

programmes.show_name: The Wrong Arm Of the Law
programmes.show_description: 1963. Comedy. Director: Cliff Owen. Stars Peter Sellers, Lionel Jeffries, Bernard Cribbins & Nanette Newman. A gangster learns of a traitor in his midst and makes a deal with the police.
1960. The Dover Road Mystery. Directed by Gerard Bryant. Starring Geoffrey Keen, Edward Cast and Leonard Sachs. A stolen car used in a bank robbery proves too fast for the squad car. (S1, E32)
Never Back Losers. 1961. Directed by Robert Tronson. Stars Jack Hedley, Jacqueline Ellis & Patrick Magee. An insurance investigator tackles a vicious gambling ring.
1965. Adventure. Directed by Richard Brooks. Stars James Mason, Peter O'Toole & Curt Jurgens. A discredited seaman, desperately seeking to redeem himself, agrees to deliver a dangerous shipment.
Brother and sister duo Inez and Charlie Foxx perform the spectacular hit Mockingbird.
1963. Crime drama directed by Ernest Morris and starring Paul Maxwell, Clare Owen and Anita West. Waiting for his flight home from Baghdad, Bill takes a message from a British secret agent.
1947. Thriller. Director: Sidney Gilliat. Stars Trevor Howard, Sally Gray & Rosamund John. Against a background of bombing raids, a series of murders take place in a hospital during WW2.
Contraband. 1962. Stars Joseph Brady, Brian Blessed & Stratford Johns. PC Smith meets a stranger selling suspicious wristwatches. The captain assigns him and PC Weir to stake out the dock.
Tonight, at the Cellar Club, Caroline Munro is here to introduce the second episode of Supernatural!
Countess Ilona. 1977. Stars Billie Whitelaw, Ian Hendry & John Fraser. Countess Ilona invites four gentlemen to her castle but the men are not expecting what she has planned for them.
Caroline Munro is back to introduce tonight's film: Messiah of Evil. Prepare for this 1970s horror, full of strange and supernatural happenings.
1974. Horror. Director: Willard Huyck & Gloria Katz. Stars Micheal Greer, Marianna Hill & Joy Bang. A young woman finds a mysterious undead cult while searching for her missing artist father.
As the end of this week's Cellar Club draws near, Caroline Munro is here to talk about what is coming up next week.

programmes.show_name: Hammer House of Mystery and Suspense
programmes.show_description: A Distant Scream. 1984. Stars David Carradine, Stephanie Beacham & Stephen Greif. An old man, who has spent 20 years in prison for murder, gets a chance to go back to the past.
1941. Drama. Directed by Frank Capra. Stars Gary Cooper, Barbara Stanwyck & Edward Arnold. A drifter finds himself at the centre of a political movement after becoming part of a fraudulent story.

programmes.show_name: The Fall of the House of Usher (1950)
programmes.show_description: 1950. Horror. A traveller arrives at Usher mansion to visit his friend Roderick (Kaye Tendeter) and discovers that Roderick and his sister (Gwen Watford) have been inflicted with a strange disease.
Made in 1940, a silent short transferred from 9.5mm. Enjoy some of the earliest antics of the iconic duo with astounding stunts!
Fly Casting/The Log Splitter. 1986. Jack Hargreaves illustrates the technical advances in fly fishing. He then shows us his latest gadget for chopping logs for his wood burning stove.
1935. Action. Director: Elmer Clifton. Stars Rex Lease, Dorothy Gulliver & Earl Douglas. A group of Desperados menace a mining operation.
1945. In this charming short video Charlie Chester promotes the importance of orange juice for children under five.
Peterkin. 1974. Stars John Sanderson, Roberta Tovey & Nigel Havers. Black Arrow rescues Peterkin from the clutches of Lord William. Later, they uncover an outlaw plot to steal a holy relic.
1997. Stars Brendan Pollecutt, Fezile Mpela & Robert Finlayson. A small group of friends become stranded and lost in a jungle after embarking on a journey to an archaeological site.
Shepherd's War. 1956. Stars: William Russell, Cyril Smith & Ronald Leigh-Hunt. Hearing that friendly shepherds are under attack by plundering knights, Sir Lancelot volunteers to help.
Pop Goes the Joker. 1967. Stars Adam West, Burt Ward & Alan Napier. The Joker takes advantage of his vandalism being mistaken for pop art so Batman must discover his true scheme.
Bad Neighbours. 1954. Stars Roy Rogers, Trigger & Dale Evans. Roy has to help settle the dispute between the ranchers and the farmers after homesteader Frank Steward is found shot.
Tune of Danger. 1964. Stars David Graham, Lois Maxwell & Don Mason. Agent X20 learns that a jazz group is to give a concert in Pacifica and plans to plant a bomb in one of the instruments.
The Golden Wheel. 1958. Stars: Conrad Phillips, Willoughby Goddard & Jennifer Jayne. Having discovered where the resistance hides its funds, Gessler make plans to stop further money reaching them.
Before The Mast. 1956. Stars Robert Shaw, Ferdy Mayne & Roger Snowdon. When a pirate ship is seen in the waters around New Providence, Tempest hatches a daring plan to destroy the ship.
Secret Mission. 1956. Stars Richard Greene, Victor Woolf & Archie Duncan. The Sheriff of Nottingham offers to pardon Robin if he pledges allegiance to King John.
1965. Sci-fi. Directed by Koreyoshi Akasaka, Teruo Ishii & Akira Mitsuwa. Stars Ken Utsui & Sachihiro Ohsawa. The rulers of planet Emerald send superhero Starman to protect Earth from evil aliens.
1952. Action. Director: Ken Annakin. Stars Richard Todd, Joan Rice & James Hayter. When King Richard leaves England for the Holy Land, his subjects are left at the mercy of his cunning brother.
Thames Division. 1958. Stars Robert Beatty, Patrick Troughton & Delphi Lawrence. Carson is found murdered in his cabin. The discovery of heroin in one of his shoes alerts Scotland Yard.
Barbed Wire. 1961. Stars Peter Graves, Anthony Wickert & Gerry Duggan. Cobb gets caught in a land war when he delivers barbed wire to some local farmers.
1956. War drama. Directed by Lewis Gilbert and stars Kenneth More, Muriel Pavlow and Lyndon Brook. This is the true story of Douglas Bader, who loses his legs but returns to flight during WW2.
The Crooked Castle. 1962. Stars Rupert Davies, Ewen Solon & Victor Lucas. Maigret descends upon a small town north of Paris after a diamond dealer is found murdered in the garage of a house.
1979. Crime. Director: Bob Clark. Stars: Christopher Plummer, James Mason & David Hemmings. Holmes investigates Jack the Ripper's murders and discovers a conspiracy to protect the killer.
The Double Affair. 1964. Stars Robert Vaughn, David McCallum & Leo G. Carroll. Using a body double, Thrush seeks to control an energy source that is to be used if Earth is ever invaded.
Costumers. 1994. Narrated by Oliver Reed. A look at Hammer's historical costume dramas, including swashbucklers such as The Brigand of Kandahar, A Challenge for Robin Hood and Wolfshead.
